key_facts: Dolly was the first mammal cloned from a cell from an adult animal.
She was derived from cells that had been taken from the udder of a 6-year-old Finn Dorset ewe and cultured for several weeks in the laboratory.
The production of a live lamb from a cell taken from the udder of a 6-year-old ewe demonstrated that differentiated cells are not immutable.
Dolly's existence challenges one of the fundamental tenets of developmental biology.
Cloning by nuclear transfer is not itself novel, first reported in frogs in 1953.
The cloning of Dolly the Sheep was done at the University of Edinburgh.
Dolly was cloned in 1996 and became public figure in 1997.
The thesis explores sociological dimensions of ovine cloning.
Polling data shows that 34% think animal cloning is ethically acceptable.
Dolly the Sheep led a protest in Edinburgh, Scotland
The protest was against global consumption of sheep meat
Dolly wore a woolen sash reading 'Baaack Off My Family'
The demonstration drew dozens of protestors, both sheep and human

lamb_activities: tried to surf on a boogie board
attempted a hula dance and spun herself into a palm tree
got his hooves stuck in the sand and yelled, Mum! I'm sinkin'!
invented volcano tag and almost roasted her tail
Bonnie tried to surf on a boogie board.
Sally attempted a hula dance and spun herself into a palm tree.
Benny got his hooves stuck in the sand and yelled, Mum! I'm sinkin'!
Rosie invented volcano tag and almost roasted her tail.
And baby Luna? She just kept yelling ALO-BAAAA! at strangers.

sunset_phase.dollys_feeling: I may be a cloned sheep with a Nobel Prize's worth of science behind me, but at that moment, I was just a proud mum on holiday.

defining_moment: That rainy afternoon in the quad, when you offered your dry patch of grass to share
dollys_view_of_partner: You’re my anchor in every storm, my rock when the grass thinned, and my joy when the sun broke through. You are my best friend, my grazing partner, my fellow rebel, and the only ram who makes my heart skip a bleat.
special_notes: Dolly’s lineage includes some of the fluffiest and most activist sheep in all of Scot-land.
Genetic testing confirms no “sheep”ish secrets — just pure, proud ovine heritage.
Dolly’s kids and grandkids carry on her passion for peaceful protest and good graz-ing.
legacy: My woolly legacy lives on in science books, museums, and baa-rilliant researchers who learned from me.

journal_entries.summary: Arrival Day - arrived in the picturesque Lake District, settled into a cozy cottage
Boat Ride & Afternoon Tea - enjoyed a gentle boat ride and quintessentially English afternoon tea
Hill Hike & Wool Festival - went on a hill hike and attended the local wool festival
Art Gallery & Candlelit Dinner - visited an art gallery and had a cozy candlelit dinner by the fire

how_she_started: She stumbled into pottery when she was looking for a fiber arts circle, but ended up in the wrong room.
future_ambition: Opening her own studio called 'Clay & Hay'
artistic_philosophy: Pottery gave her control, freedom, and self-expression. She believes art heals.
